org.ajoberstar.grgit
[Groovy] Class Grgit

java.lang.Object
  org.ajoberstar.grgit.Grgit

class Grgit

Provides support for performaing operations on and getting information about a Git repository.

A Grgit instance can be obtained via 3 methods.

  • Open an existing repository.

    def grgit = Grgit.open('path/to/my/repo')

  • Initialize a new repository.

    def grgit = Grgit.init(dir: new File('path/to/my/repo'))

  • Clone an existing repository.

    def grgit = Grgit.open(dir: new File('path/to/my/repo'), uri: 'git@github.com:ajoberstar/grgit.git')

Once obtained, operations can be called with two syntaxes.

  • Map syntax. Any public property on the *Op class can be provided as a Map entry.

    grgit.commit(message: 'Committing my code.', amend: true)

  • Closure syntax. Any public property or method on the *Op class can be used.

     grgit.log {
   range 'master', 'my-new-branch'
   maxCommits = 5
 }

Details of each operation's properties and methods are available on the doc page for the class. The following operations are supported directly on a Grgit instance.

  • add
  • apply
  • checkout
  • clean
  • commit
  • fetch
  • log
  • merge
  • pull
  • push
  • remove
  • reset
  • revert

And the following operations are supported statically on the Grgit class.

  • clone
  • init
Since:
0.1.0

head

Commit head()

methodMissing

java.lang.Object methodMissing(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object args)

open

static Grgit open(java.lang.String rootDirPath, Credentials creds = null)
Opens a Grgit instance in rootDirPath. If credentials are provided they will be used for all operations with using remotes.
throws:
GrgitException if an existing Git repository can't be opened in rootDirPath
Parameters:
rootDirPath - path to the repository's root directory
creds - harcoded credentials to use for remote operations

open

static Grgit open(java.io.File rootDir, Credentials creds = null)
Opens a Grgit instance in rootDir. If credentials are provided they will be used for all operations with using remotes.
throws:
GrgitException if an existing Git repository can't be opened in rootDir
Parameters:
rootDir - path to the repository's root directory
creds - harcoded credentials to use for remote operations

resolveCommit

Commit resolveCommit(java.lang.String revstr)
Resolves the given revision string to a commit given the current state of the repository. Any Git revision string should be supported.
throws:
GrgitException if there was a problem finding the commit
Returns:
the commit represented by revstr
Parameters:
revstr - a revision string representing the desired commit
